key_concepts.euclids_division_lemma: For given positive integers a and b, there exist unique integers q and r such that a = bq + r, 0 ≤ r < b

fundamental_theorem_of_arithmetic.statement: Every composite number can be expressed as a product of primes, and this factorisation is unique

irrational_numbers.definition: Numbers that cannot be expressed as p/q where p and q are integers and q ≠ 0

decimal_expansion.terminating: Denominator has only prime factors 2 and/or 5
decimal_expansion.non_terminating_repeating: Denominator has primes other than 2 and 5

chapters.one_liner: Real numbers look simple—until you’re asked to prove something.

key_concepts.polynomial: An expression of the form a_n x^n + a_(n-1) x^(n-1) + ... + a_1 x + a_0, where n is a non-negative integer
key_concepts.degree_of_polynomial: Highest power of the variable in the polynomial
key_concepts.zero_of_polynomial: A value of x for which the polynomial becomes zero

graphical_representation.cubic: Curve with at most three zeroes

division_algorithm_for_polynomials.statement: For any polynomial f(x) and g(x), where g(x) ≠ 0, there exist polynomials q(x) and r(x) such that f(x) = g(x)·q(x) + r(x)
division_algorithm_for_polynomials.condition: Degree of r(x) < degree of g(x)

chapters.one_liner: Polynomials are algebra behaving politely—until graphs enter the room.

chapters.chapter_name: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables

key_concepts.linear_equation_in_two_variables: An equation of the form ax + by + c = 0, where a, b, and c are real numbers and a and b are not both zero
key_concepts.solution_of_pair: A pair of values of x and y that satisfy both equations simultaneously

graphical_method.description: Solutions are represented by the point of intersection of two straight lines

substitution_method.idea: Substitute the value of one variable from one equation into the other equation

elimination_method.idea: Eliminate one variable by adding or subtracting the equations

cross_multiplication_method.applicable_when: Equations are in the form a1x + b1y + c1 = 0 and a2x + b2y + c2 = 0

chapters.one_liner: Two equations, two variables—either they meet, run parallel, or walk the same path.

key_concepts.quadratic_equation: An equation of the form ax^2 + bx + c = 0, where a ≠ 0

factorisation_method.idea: Express the quadratic equation as a product of two linear factors

completing_the_square_method.idea: Convert the equation into a perfect square

chapters.one_liner: Quadratics are where algebra stops talking and starts proving.

key_concepts.arithmetic_progression: A sequence of numbers in which the difference between consecutive terms is constant
key_concepts.first_term: The first term of an arithmetic progression, denoted by a
key_concepts.common_difference: The constant difference between successive terms, denoted by d

methods: Using sum of n terms formula

applications: Problems based on daily life situations
chapters.one_liner: Arithmetic Progressions reward consistency—miss one step and the whole sequence collapses.

key_concepts.similar_triangles: Triangles having the same shape but not necessarily the same size
key_concepts.congruent_triangles: Triangles having the same shape and the same size

criteria_for_similarity.name: AA Similarity
criteria_for_similarity.description: Two angles of one triangle are equal to two angles of another triangle

criteria_for_similarity.name: SSS Similarity
criteria_for_similarity.description: Corresponding sides of two triangles are in the same ratio

criteria_for_similarity.name: SAS Similarity
criteria_for_similarity.description: Two sides are in the same ratio and the included angle is equal

theorems.name: Basic Proportionality Theorem
theorems.statement: A line drawn parallel to one side of a triangle divides the other two sides in the same ratio

theorems.name: Pythagoras Theorem
theorems.statement: In a right-angled triangle, the square of the hypotenuse is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides

theorems.name: Converse of Pythagoras Theorem
theorems.statement: If the square of one side of a triangle is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides, then the triangle is right-angled

chapters.one_liner: Triangles don’t forgive shortcuts—either the proof stands or it falls.

key_concepts.coordinate_plane: A plane formed by the intersection of the x-axis and y-axis
key_concepts.coordinates_of_a_point: An ordered pair (x, y) representing the position of a point on the plane

distance_formula.statement: Distance between two points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)

internal_division.description: Coordinates of a point dividing a line segment internally in the ratio m:n

applications: Finding coordinates of points dividing a line segment
chapters.one_liner: Coordinate Geometry turns pictures into numbers—and numbers don’t lie.

key_concepts.trigonometry: The branch of mathematics that deals with the relationships between angles and sides of a right-angled triangle
key_concepts.right_angled_triangle: A triangle in which one angle is 90 degrees

trigonometric_ratios_of_standard_angles.note: Values are defined using geometry and limits

chapters.one_liner: Trigonometry is memory plus logic—forget the table and you’re done.

key_concepts.angle_of_elevation: The angle between the horizontal line and the line of sight when an object is above the observer
key_concepts.angle_of_depression: The angle between the horizontal line and the line of sight when an object is below the observer

applications: Real-life problems involving line of sight
assumptions: Object and observer are on the same horizontal plane
Line of sight is a straight line
chapters.one_liner: Heights and distances look hard—until you draw the triangle.

key_concepts.circle: The set of all points in a plane that are at a fixed distance from a fixed point called the centre
key_concepts.radius: The fixed distance from the centre to any point on the circle
key_concepts.tangent: A line that touches the circle at exactly one point

tangent_properties: The tangent to a circle at any point is perpendicular to the radius through the point of contact
From an external point, the lengths of the tangents drawn to a circle are equal

theorems.name: Tangent-Radius Theorem
theorems.statement: The tangent at any point of a circle is perpendicular to the radius at the point of contact

theorems.name: Equal Tangents Theorem
theorems.statement: The lengths of tangents drawn from an external point to a circle are equal

chapters.one_liner: Circles look smooth—but their theorems are razor sharp.

key_concepts.geometrical_construction: Accurate drawing of geometric figures using only ruler and compass
key_concepts.scale_factor: Ratio by which a figure is enlarged or reduced

types_of_constructions.description: Dividing a line segment in a given ratio internally
Construction of a triangle similar to a given triangle with a given scale factor

steps_for_triangle_construction: Construct a ray making an acute angle
Mark equal segments on the ray
Join the last point to the vertex
Draw a parallel line to get the required triangle
important_notes: Construction steps must be neat and labelled
chapters.one_liner: In constructions, perfection isn’t optional—it’s the answer.

key_concepts.circle: The set of all points in a plane that are at a fixed distance from a fixed point
key_concepts.radius: Distance from the centre to any point on the circle
key_concepts.sector: A part of a circle enclosed by two radii and the corresponding arc
key_concepts.segment: A part of a circle enclosed by a chord and the corresponding arc

area_of_segment.minor_segment: Area of sector − Area of triangle
area_of_segment.major_segment: Area of circle − Area of minor segment

applications: Finding areas of sectors and segments
Solving word problems involving circular paths
important_notes: Diagrams must be neat and labelled
chapters.one_liner: Memorise the formulas—or the circle will trap you.

key_concepts.surface_area: The total area of the outer surface of a solid
key_concepts.volume: The amount of space occupied by a solid

chapters.one_liner: In 3D geometry, the diagram is half the solution.

key_concepts.statistics: The study of collection, presentation, analysis, and interpretation of numerical data
key_concepts.frequency_distribution: A table showing the frequency of values within given class intervals

mode.definition: The value that occurs most frequently in a data set

median.definition: The value that divides the data into two equal parts

important_notes: Correct identification of median and modal class is crucial
chapters.one_liner: Statistics doesn’t test intelligence—it tests attention to detail.

key_concepts.experiment: An action or process that results in one or more outcomes
key_concepts.outcome: A possible result of an experiment
key_concepts.sample_space: The set of all possible outcomes of an experiment

probability.classical_definition: Probability = Number of favourable outcomes / Total number of possible outcomes

types_of_events.sure_event: An event that is certain to occur
types_of_events.equally_likely_events: Events having the same chance of occurring

examples: Picking a card from a deck
chapters.one_liner: Probability is logic under uncertainty—no guessing allowed.
